description: <em>At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us.</em><p><br></p><em>The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees’ personal and professional lives.</em><p><br></p><strong>Position Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Senior Analyst, Consumer &amp; Digital Analytics develops and delivers business insights for Consumer Media/Digital Marketing function, with a strong focus on translating and enhancing the utilization of data and analytics. Bring in an enhanced understanding of available data, analyses, and performance levers</li><li>Manage execution and distribution of reports/dashboards</li><li>Develop and foster relationships with internal/external partners to manage work-streams and cross-function deliverables</li><li>Develop, extend, and improve analytics processes to ensure consistent delivery of actionable data and insights to stakeholders and decision makers</li><li>Support ad hoc projects and tasks as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA/BS required</li><li>2-4 years of experience in Consumer Digital Analytics and/or Marketing Analytics</li><li>Experience analyzing websites traffic data using Google Analytics, knowledge of Digital Marketing strategies like Paid Search, Social Media</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in data management and data platforms (such as Microsoft SQL Server), statistical modeling packages (such as Python, SAS, and/or, R) and office productivity software (Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel)</li><li>Familiarity with cloud-based database tools like Google BigQuery</li><li>Demonstrated success developing and presenting solutions to complex business situations, supported by sound and thorough analytics</li><li>Highly proficient analytical and software skills aimed at data analysis</li><li>Familiarity with pharmaceutical data including Rx, physician and claims data preferred</li><li>High degree of independence and exceptional work ethic</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Professional, proactive demeanor</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Values</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference.</li><li>Accountability: We do what’s right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures.</li><li>Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one’s team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective</li><li>Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources</li><li>Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments</li><li>Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working</li><li>Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better.</em><p><br></p><em>Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. title: Infrastructure Engineer (Platform)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As a Platform Engineer(DevOps), you will build, maintain, and support the OpenShift Container Platform in a DevOps model. You’ll use code to bridge the gap between software and hardware and produce an efficient and reliable infrastructure. By harnessing your creativity and passion for continuous learning, you’ll create a fully digitized end-to-end process for managing the lifecycle of infrastructure resources. You’ll deploy programmable, easily customizable infrastructure that embraces change and automates the deployment process to reduce risk. You’ll also analyze all platform level changes, monitor application impact, and provide appropriate technical solutions to resolve all issues quickly and efficiently. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of OpenShift / k8s Master control plane components. </li><li>Understanding of k8s operator model. </li><li>Understanding of any one OpenShift / K8s supported Networking CNI. (Plus if you know Calico ) </li><li>High level understanding of AWS infrastructure (VPC / Security groups / EC2 / Storages / Load Balancers) </li><li>Understanding of platform automation products like RH ACM / Terraform / Ansible</li><li>Programing skills in Golang language (is a Super Advantage) </li><li>Scripting languages like shell / Helm modules or some programming experience. </li><li>Nice to have event driven programing understanding. </li><li>Any cloud experience like Azure / Google as infra as a service provider </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Complete required Regulation B reporting to CIBC’s Compliance team on a monthly basis.</li><li>Completion of the risk rating validation of the Community Development Group loan portfolio on a quarterly basis (including fiscal year end).</li><li>Completion of monthly reporting on non-performing, criticized and past due loans to CIBC’s Credit Risk Management team.</li><li>Review transactions closed on a monthly basis to document and report any credit exceptions to Community Development Group’s credit policy and procedures. Assist with the reporting of credit exceptions to the Small Business Exception Forum.</li><li>Completion of Notices of Default and Collection letters to Community Development Group customers that are past due on loan payments (including loan maturities).</li><li>Provide necessary loan documents to CIBC’s outside collection agency for transactions that are transferred to collections.</li><li>Complete necessary reporting on Community Development Group real estate transactions.</li><li>Provide supporting documentation to support ongoing Compliance monitoring as well as annual Compliance audits.</li><li>Complete the necessary reporting to Compliance associated with any formal complaints received from existing or prospective Community Development Group customers.</li><li>Assist with updates of business-specific processes and procedures, as applicable, in alignment with existing frameworks, policies, standards, and risk appetites.</li><li>Assist with the account management including the monitoring of past due payments received from of distressed portfolio accounts. </li><li>Work with Governance &amp; Controls teams (1Bs) or Internal Audit as needed to respond to Internal Audit reviews and findings.</li><li>Support procedural training (as applicable)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compliance Requirements/Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge and Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>College education and equivalent of 3+ years of job experience in financial services industry.</li><li>Proficiency in banking applications and Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Possess creative problem-solving abilities</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication</li><li>Good organizational skills including attention to detail and follow through</li><li>Ability to work well under compressed time constraints</li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects at one time</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What you need to know:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. title: Solutions Engineer
description: Securitas is a global company that offers the most advanced and sustainable security solutions in the industry. We are located in 47 countries and have 355,000 employees worldwide and over 150,000 clients. Our mission is to help companies protect their most important assets. Utilizing state of the art technology combined with great people, we design custom solutions for our clients.<p><br></p>As the <strong>Solutions Engineer</strong> for Securitas, you'll invest your time uncovering sales opportunities, building relationships with your team and prospects, all while laying the foundation for a long and rewarding career in a growing industry. Your goal will be to compete against yourself and achieve the levels of success you know you are capable of. Your success will lead to the increased protection of commercial properties across your territory, while simultaneously developing your name as the local expert and go to leader in security solutions. You will work alongside the Technology Operations Management Team who will be responsible for the installation and maintenance of the sold systems. This role interfaces with clients, managers and executives serving as the technical expert for security systems. You will attend client meetings, provide technology advice, prepare and respond to bids and RFP's. This position is also responsible for creating and presenting integrated guarding sales proposals.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits:</strong><p><br></p>At Securitas, we ask a lot of our employees, but we also give a lot in return. In addition to your competitive salary, medical/dental/vision plan, car allowance, and 401(k), we'll prove our commitment to you with these extra benefits.<p><br></p><strong>Flexible Schedule:</strong> This position is based in Downers Grove, IL and is an autonomous position where you hold the responsibility of structuring your day to achieve the highest levels of success.<p><br></p><strong>Training:</strong> We will invest heavily in your training and ensure you are properly equipped to secure profitable business for both you and the company.<p><br></p><strong>Experience:</strong> At least 4 years of outside sales experience with meeting and exceeding quota is preferred.<p><br></p><strong>Education: </strong>4-year college degree is preferred.<p><br></p><strong>Skills:</strong> You must be good at time management, organization, presentations and communication. You must understand the mechanics of complex selling, have a process for lead generation, and thrive on prospecting activity.<p><br></p>Come join our team and help make our world a safer place.<p><br></p>See a different world.<p><br></p>IDFPR License #122-000899<p><br></p>EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabilities<p><br></p>#AF-NCSCHICILHP<p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Securitas employees come from all walks of life, bringing with them a variety of distinctive skills and perspectives. United through our common purpose, we provide the security needed to safeguard our clients' assets and people. Our core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are represented by the three red dots in the Securitas logo. If you live by these values, we're looking for you to join the Securitas team.<p><br></p><strong>About The Team</strong><p><br></p>Our Company Mission:<p><br></p>Securitas' mission is to protect homes, workplaces, and communities by providing the security services they need to protect their assets, safeguard their people, and maintain their ability to generate profits.<p><br></p>Our Values:<p><br></p>Securitas' core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are the foundation for our employees to build trust with customers, colleagues, and the surrounding community.<p><br></p>Integrity:<p><br></p>Securitas employees are honest and trusted by customers to safeguard their premises and valuables. We don't compromise on integrity and create an open forum for our employees and customers to voice opinions, report improprieties, and share information.<p><br></p>Vigilance:<p><br></p>Seeing, hearing, and evaluating. A Securitas employee is always attentive and often notices things that others don't. Their vigilance is necessary in order to be aware of potential risks or incidents that may take place on our customers' premises.<p><br></p>Helpfulness:<p><br></p>As part of an on-going effort to ensure safety, Securitas employees are always ready to help if an incident occurs that requires intervention regardless of whether or not it is directly related to their job.
